topics.body:
I just had a interesting thought.

You know how 10% of San Francisco is glbt?  For the longest time the theory for why that is was "because glbt migrate to the city"; well that theory got fucking shot down hard a while back cause nobody could show any level of evidence for it.

Going to Alfred Kinsey's initial studies on human sexuality something that a lot of people miss is that the "14%" figure isn't a measure of how many people identify as glbt, but rather sexual stimulation versus how current estimates put glbt population more at 2%.

What do I mean all this?  The simplest explanation is that the drastic difference between the two figures isn't "people are in the closet", but rather the 12% difference is simply people that open to gay relationships.  To put it simply only a small fraction of the population is glbt, *BUT* a much greater percentage of people wouldn't mind being in a gay relationship.

To put it another way; there are gay relationships where one person is straight because they're only gay for that person.  What I mean by this is it's totally possible for someone to look at straight porn, be interested in women sexuality wise and still love his husband and find him sexually attractive and love to have sex with him.


Even though it's been fifty years I still think the Kinsey scale still has some merit, cause if you're a 1 on the kinsey scale even though you're technically straight that means to some level you'd be open to a gay relationship.

What does this have to do with San Francisco?  Simply put: maybe the reason why so many people are in gay relationships isn't because "people are migrating to the city" or "3/20ths of the population are in the closet", but rather those people don't give a metaphorical fuck about sexual identities and are just banging people they like instead?

Tl:dr; maybe human beings will bang anything?
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

But I do have money to spare
And I haven't bought anything else for a while now


hmmmmm[/bq]
I really wouldn't.

Yeah I know I'm biased and I know everyone knows I'm biased, *BUT* the vita was recently moved to legacy.  What this means is that the vita is effectively dead.  If you're thinking of buying a vita I wouldn't buy one cause Sony's effectively killed it off.  If you already have a vita then it's probably going to start having less and less new titles as time goes on.  They're still offering support for it for a couple years though.

"@SidewardManatee":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5585d49a6368725e39000250#post_5585d49a6368725e39000250
It's just opinion, but I think like fifty years from now 10% of the population will be in gay relationships, but the people who identify as glbt will stay around 2% cause what is probably going to happen is:
One guy, "I like you"
Other guy, "I like you too, but I like porn solely of women and that"
First guy, "It's okay; we can still date if you're interested"
Other guy, "Let's make out"


Human sexuality is weird, cause it's totally possible for someone to romantically love someone of the same sex and not be gay or bisexual.

Human sexuality is weird cause there's a difference between romantic interest and sexual interest.
"@mariomarc":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5585d4c063687235eb000ee8#post_5585d4c063687235eb000ee8
Well on the plus side since the Vita is officially unofficially dead you'll be able to buy a lot of older games.  Whenever a device is canned they start marking down games in the long run to clear them off the shelf like when the ps2 got shut down they started drastically marking down ps2 games to clear their stock.

topics.body:
"@mariomarc":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5585d72563687235eb0011fd#post_5585d72563687235eb0011fd
. . . I may be biased towards pc, but yeah. . sucks to be you on this.

Sony is still having legacy support for it and there will probably continue to be *some* games new games for the next two or three years, but yeah it's like buying a ps2 now; ie buy it for games that are already out or games you know are coming out, not cause you think it's going to make a comeback.

It double sucks for sony fans cause if they've already put it on legacy without announcing a new handheld then it's pretty much official that sony has quit handhelds.  Normally whenever a company puts a device on legacy that's when they announce the next product, but considering that sony hasn't announced a vita 2 eeyup it's over.

!https://spiritualmusclehead.files.wordpress.com/2013/04/hes-dead-jim.jpg?w=300!

Tl:dr; if a company that makes video game devices puts something on legacy without announcing a newer version then almost always that means they're pulling out of that.
